name: Tiger Lily
climate: Tiger lilies thrive in temperate climates with moderate rainfall.
They can withstand cool nights and warm days, making them versatile.
This plant prefers climates with well-defined seasons for proper growth.
They are tolerant of humidity and can grow in subtropical regions.
sunlight: Tiger lilies require full sun to partial shade for optimal blooming.
In areas with hot summers, some afternoon shade can be beneficial.
The plant needs at least six hours of sunlight daily to flourish.
Too much shade will result in fewer flowers and leggy growth.
watering: Water tiger lilies regularly to keep the soil consistently moist.
These plants need deep watering during dry spells to support growth.
Avoid waterlogged conditions by ensuring proper drainage to prevent rot.
Reduce watering in fall as the plant prepares for dormancy in winter.
soil: Tiger lilies prefer rich, loamy soil that drains well for healthy roots.
They can tolerate a range of soil pH levels but prefer slightly acidic.
Amend clay soils with organic matter to enhance drainage and fertility.
Sandy soils can support these lilies if they retain enough moisture.
toxic: Tiger lilies are toxic to cats and can cause kidney failure if ingested.
extra_care_tip: Deadhead spent flowers to encourage more blooms throughout the season.
